titleStmt.title: A letter sent by order of both Houses of Parliament, to the high sheriffe of every shire, concerning matters of great consequence. Also an order of both Houses of Parliament; concerning such persons as are appointed for gathering of such sums of money in London, as is intended for the reducing of the rebels in Ireland. Ordered by both Houses to be printed.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Iohn Franke, and are to be sold at his shop next doore to the Kings head in Fleetstreet,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
